name: v2021.11.9
body:
Due to an oversight, the last two releases were not pushed to the ansible galaxy.
This release fixes CI checks and should be available on ansible galaxy again.

* fix: drop outdated operating systems from CI (#117) @ltalirz 
* chore: remove dokku_ecr and dokku_consul (#121) @ltalirz

name: v2021.11.7
body:
* chore: bump ansible version for tests (#118) @ltalirz 
* chore: update copyright statement (#116) @ltalirz 
* fix: set build=True for `dokku_clone` as mentioned in the docs (#120) @josegonzalez

name: v2021.10.2
body: * feat: `dokku_ps_scale` module (#115) @gavinballard

name: v2021.9.5
body: * fix dokku_app import (#111) @ltalirz

name: v2021.9.3
body:
* `dokku_clone`: add `version` parameter and switch to `git:sync` (#98) @ltalirz 
* reduce code duplication (#109) @ltalirz 
* feat: dokku_network and dokku_network_property modules (#108) @lemoony 

This release requires dokku version 0.23.0 or later (or the `dokku_clone` module will not work).
Please [upgrade your dokku version](https://github.com/dokku/dokku/blob/master/docs/getting-started/upgrading.md#migration-guides), either manually or e.g. by pinning the `dokku_version` role variable.

name: v2021.5.9
body: * fix: dokku_ports filters out existing mapping (#107) @wjzijderveld

name: v2021.5.8
body:
* add dokku_letsencrypt module (#105) @gavinballard 
* add dokku_resource_limit and dokku_resource_reserve modules (#104) @apavanello

name: v2021.2.22
body: * package pinning: fix installation order (#101)

name: v2021.2.17
body: * fix (deprecated) version pinning (#100 )

name: v2021.2.3
body:
* fix permissions for apt version pinning files (#95)
* docs: ubuntu focal support (#96)
* feat: make version pinning optional (#97)

This release turns off pinning the versions of dokku-related packages by default (but will not update packages that are already installed).
If you wish to continue pinning the versions of dokku-related packages, you now need to provide values to the corresponding variables (`dokku_version`, `herokuish_version`, ...) explicitly.
